title: rustc: Compiler index error, out of bound

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-beta
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to beta.

labels.name: S-has-mcve
labels.description: A Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example has been found for this issue

body:
### Code ```Rust fn prime_elem(n: u64) -> u64 { let mut primes = Vec::new(); let mut j = 0; for i in 2..n+1 { if primes.contains(i) { j = i*i; while j < n+1 { primes.push(j); j += i; } } } primes[n] } fn main() { let _prime = prime_elem(10001); println!("{_prime}"); } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.69.0-nightly (7281249a1 2023-02-27) binary: rustc commit-hash: 7281249a19a9755e9d889ee251ec323629caadab commit-date: 2023-02-27 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.69.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.7 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 33 but the index is 34', /cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f/ena-0.14.1/src/snapshot_vec.rs:199:10 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7f8538f66baa -
